Replying to @philhawksworth 2020-03-11 10:15
@_rndlph @smashingmag There is an overhead to hosting and maintenance which can be reduced. You're right that it's not new. But the web has matured, providing greater opportunities thanks to services and APIs and more powerful browsers. So the term tries to help convey that.
  • Permalink

Replying to @r_nd_lph 2020-03-11 10:13
@_rndlph @smashingmag I think I'd challenge the view that it is rarely acceptable. The majority of sites on the web don't need their views re-rendered on the fly for every request. Or need a database. Think of how many WordPress blogs exist that hit a database for every view, but change infrequently.
